weather_report:
As we step into the morning in Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a crispness that hints at a brief summery warmth before the day settles into its characteristic coolness. The forecast promises a sunny day, with the temperature reaching approximately 60 degrees before gently retreating to around 57 by afternoon. Yet, even now, a veil of fog lingers, softening the edges of the skyline and imparting a muted glow upon the familiar silhouettes of the buildings. The southwest winds stir softly at 6 to 10 mph, a reminder of the ocean's presence not far away.

Tonight, expect a calm transition into a partly cloudy evening, where temperatures will dip to around 50 degrees, ushered along by the west southwest winds. In this weather, one might opt for layers; a light sweater or jacket will be suitable as the warmth of the sun wanes, providing comfort against the evening chill. Today invites a leisurely stroll through the city or a quiet moment in one of the parks, savoring a coffee while watching the fog dance around the hills. Perhaps a visit to a local bookstore would be ideal, where one can escape into the pages of a novel, surrounded by the soft hum of life outside. Embrace the day as it unfolds, for San Francisco, even in the fog, holds a beauty all its own.
